By sequencing the RNA of the SARS-CoV-2 virus to identify potential targets.
By predicting the secondary structure of the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein.
By generating synthetic nanobodies for experimental testing.

To sequence the genomes of T6SS effectors and immunity proteins.
To design small molecule inhibitors for T6SS effectors.
To analyze the evolutionary history of T6SS effector-immunity pairs.

It measures the evolutionary conservation of protein sequences.
It calculates the molecular weight of protein complexes.

What potential advantage does the study: It streamlines the virtual screening process, reducing the need for extensive experimental validation.

BLAST, for sequence alignment and comparison.
